dict.string: Human Language Processing / Understanding What would constitute AI level language processing? Early Attempts dictionary grammar for disambiguation Not very effective Stochastic correlation identify contextual relationships to remove ambiguity Linguistics the study of languages areas of study semantics - meaning syntactics - grammar / structure pragmatics - how language is used in practice, purposes for using language phonetics - spoken language semeiotics - written language lexical - dictionary, set of words in a language Which areas will help us with human language processing? semantics - use dictionary to get meaning of words syntactics - grammar Pragmatics - how is language used Convey information Social Entertainment Propaganda - Misinformation Knowledge Representation <--> mappings <--> Human Language Better Knowledge Representations Schank conceptual dependencies Schank's scripts Spoken language text recognition is easier to decipher Ray Kurzweil developed Kurzweil reader in the 1970's Omni-font character recognition speech recognition is harder Disambiguation Human language is inherently ambiguous Methods of disambiguation Grammar Transition Networks Recursive Transition Networks Context Free Grammars only Augmented Transition Networks RTN with parameters and procedural attachment to branches of network parameters usually tense, object, etc.
